page.title: 05Boundary Walk
page.content: {BOUNDARY WALKS}started in the Middle Ages. The {'beating the bounds'}expression came from when the parents used to beat their children to make them know where their boundary was. In those days the church took 10% of the farmer's crops, so they needed to know where their land began and ended. Also if you were not in Bassenthwaite Parish you could not claim any money from the church if you were poor. On the walk, the procession of people would stop at certain trees, and a priest would say a sermon for the crops. This took place during the rogation days between Easter and Ascension day. Our last Boundary Walk was in 1974 and is due to take place again this year (1985). It is hoped to repeat the walk every 10 years.
